customer_name: HFE LLC - dba Wild Adventure Theme Park

citations.narrative:
Per facility records, two diamond doves and one golden pheasant are missing. The facility stated that two diamond doves
went missing on separate dates, one September 16, 2024 and the other on December 2, 2024. The facility identified a
gap under the enclosure door that may have allowed a predator in or the birds out. Then, on June 26, 2025, a golden
pheasant went missing from its enclosure and the facility suspected a snake was the cause.
Failure to provide a safe primary enclosure can result in injury and/or death of the birds contained within. Housing facilities
for birds must be designed and constructed for the species of bird housed in them, must be kept in good repair, protect
the birds from injury, and restrict other animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds.
Corrected prior to inspection on August 20, 2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
Per facility records, two female green monkeys had to be euthanized due to their injuries on July 14 and 15, 2025. Per a
facility representative, the troop had been fighting for two weeks prior during breeding season.
Housing nonhuman primates together that are incompatible can lead to undue stress, injury and may lead to animal
deaths. Nonhuman primates may not be housed with animals unless they are compatible, do not prevent access to food,
water, or shelter by individual animals, and are not known to be hazardous to the health and wellbeing of each other.
Corrected prior to inspection on August 20, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.150(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
Per facility records, two diamond doves and one golden pheasant are missing. The facility stated that two diamond doves 
went missing on separate dates, one September 16, 2024 and the other on December 2, 2024. The facility identified a 
gap under the enclosure door that may have allowed a predator in or the birds out. Then, on June 26, 2025, a golden 
pheasant went missing from its enclosure and the facility suspected a snake was the cause. 
 
Failure to provide a safe primary enclosure can result in injury and/or death of the birds contained within. Housing facilities 
for birds must be designed and constructed for the species of bird housed in them, must be kept in good repair, protect 
the birds from injury, and restrict other animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds. 
 
Corrected prior to inspection on August 20, 2025. 
3.81(a)(3)  Critical
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
Per facility records, two female green monkeys had to be euthanized due to their injuries on July 14 and 15, 2025. Per a 
facility representative, the troop had been fighting for two weeks prior during breeding season. 
 
Housing nonhuman primates together that are incompatible can lead to undue stress, injury and may lead to animal 
deaths. Nonhuman primates may not be housed with animals unless they are compatible, do not prevent access to food, 
water, or shelter by individual animals, and are not known to be hazardous to the health and wellbeing of each other. 
 
Corrected prior to inspection on August 20, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
